bill_title: revise certain campaign speech provisions relating to constitutional amendments, initiated measures, and referred laws.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain campaign speech provisions relating to constitutional amendments, initiated measures, and referred laws. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 12-13-16 be amended to read as follows: 12-13-16. Any person knowingly printing, publishing, or delivering to any voter of this state a document containing any purported constitutional amendment, question, law, or measure to be submitted to the voters at any election, in which such constitutional amendment, question, law, or measure is misstated, erroneously printed, or by which false or misleading information is given to the voters, is guilty of No person, during the course of any campaign in advocacy of or in opposition to the adoption of any constitutional amendment, initiated measure, or referred law, by means of campaign material, including sample ballots, an advertisement on radio or television or in a newspaper or periodical, a public speech, a press release, or otherwise, may knowingly and with intent to affect the outcome of such campaign do any of the following: (1) Falsely identify the source of a statement, issue statements under the name of another person without authorization, or falsely state the endorsement of or opposition to a constitutional amendment, initiated measure, or referred law by a person or publication; or (2) Post, publish, circulate, distribute, or otherwise disseminate, a false statement, either knowing the same to be false or acting with reckless disregard of whether it was false or not, that is designed to promote the adoption or defeat of any constitutional amendment, initiated measure, or referred law. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
